content.question:
​

Interval of <math alttext="theta"><semantics><mi>θ</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>
Distance between point <math alttext="open parentheses f open parentheses theta close parentheses comma theta close parentheses"><semantics><mfenced><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>θ</mi></mfenced><mo>,</mo><mi>θ</mi></mrow></mfenced><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> on graph of <math alttext="r equals f open parentheses theta close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>θ</mi></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> and the origin
<math alttext="open parentheses 0 comma pi over 2 close parentheses"><semantics><mfenced><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mrow></mfenced><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>
decreasing
<math alttext="open parentheses pi over 2 comma pi close parentheses"><semantics><mfenced><mrow><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mo>,</mo><mi>π</mi></mrow></mfenced><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>
increasing
<math alttext="open parentheses pi comma fraction numerator 3 pi over denominator 2 end fraction close parentheses"><semantics><mfenced><mrow><mi>π</mi><mo>,</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mrow></mfenced><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>
decreasing
<math alttext="open parentheses fraction numerator 3 pi over denominator 2 end fraction comma 2 pi close parentheses"><semantics><mfenced><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mo>,</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow></mfenced><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>
increasing
​
Let <math alttext="r equals f open parentheses theta close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>θ</mi></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> be a polar function graphed in the polar coordinate system. The table gives intervals of <math alttext="theta"><semantics><mi>θ</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> and descriptions of how the distance between a point <math alttext="open parentheses f open parentheses theta close parentheses comma theta close parentheses"><semantics><mfenced><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>θ</mi></mfenced><mo>,</mo><mi>θ</mi></mrow></mfenced><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> on the graph and the origin are changing. Which of the following could define <math alttext="f open parentheses theta close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>θ</mi></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> ?​

topic.text: 3.15: Rates of Change in Polar Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Construct new functions, using transformations, compositions, inverses, or regressions, that may be useful in modeling contexts, criteria, or data, with and without technology.
